citations.narrative:
A sheep was placed in an enclosure after undergoing a research related orthopedic procedure. This sheep slipped in her
stall resulting in a complete femoral fracture. This sheep was euthanized as this event was characterized as criteria for
euthanasia in the study protocol. This stall had previously been coating with a sample floor when occupied by the
Veterinary Teaching Hospital. It was determined that this flooring was too slick for hospital patients and the room was
decommissioned. Research took over this space and this information was not relayed to them. This sheep experienced
unnecessary pain and suffering due to being housed in an enclosure that had floors that were not of an appropriate
material to prevent injury. Housing facilities shall be constructed and maintained in a manner that protects animals from
injury. This room was decommissioned by the facility.
Correct by: Corrected at the time of inspection.

The blood donor paddock at VCS had a water receptacle used for the horses housed in the paddock. This water
receptacle had chucks of algae floating in it and larvae could be seen swimming in the water. This water receptacle is not
being kept clean and sanitary. Water receptacles in this condition can affect the palatability of the water and unsanitary
water can lead to health issue for the animals drinking it. This water receptacle needs to be cleaned more frequently.
Clean this water receptacle.
Correct by: 6/14/2024

A total of five house sparrows escaped from the facility between 4/16/2024 and 5/30/24. On 4/16/2024 one house sparrow
escaped from the behavioral cage used in the experiment. The cage was replaced with a heavier sturdier cage. On
4/24/24 a house sparrow escaped from the behavioral cage through a small opening in the cage door when being
returned to the aviary by the experimenter. On 4/30/2024 a house sparrow escaped from a hole in the aviary after
escaping a bag it was contained in by the experimenter. The aviary was being used and failed as a secondary method of
containment for this sparrow. This hole was repaired by facility personnel. On 5/03/2024 two house sparrows escaped
while behavioral experiments were being run. These sparrows again escaped through a hole in the aviary. All five of these
sparrows were never recaptured by the facility. Housing facilities for birds must be designed and constructed so that they
are structurally sound for the species of birds they maintain. They must be kept in good repair and employee security
measures that contain all birds securely. This aviary is not currently in use by the facility.
Correct by: Corrected at the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
